chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah J Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Forest & Winnebago County cases currently serving.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: from Forest County case 15CF4
Computation of credit

Court indicates defendant has been sentenced in Forest and Winnebago Counties with similar charges.  Attny Singh indicates his client believes he has credit for 408 days, however, credit was applied on his prior cases.  Arguments as to sentence by DA White and Attny Singh.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court advises about firearms and voting restrictions.  Court sentences defendant to 32 years ( 25 years confinement + 7 years extended supervision) concurrently.  Conditions of ES - Sex offender registry, no contact with victim, submit DNA sample if not already provided, any counseling and/or treatment recommended by Agent.

from Dodge Correctional for 12-17-15 Sentencing
to Judge Jorgensen requesting release of the PSI.
prosequendum from Dodge Correctional on 12-17-15
Defendant's notifications with copy of information and jury instructions
with addendum

Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  A PSI was conducted in Winnebago County for similar charges with the same victim.  Court will request a copy and determine if an addendum is needed.
Sentencing hearing at 12-17-2015 01:00 pm
from Dodge Correctional for 9-17-15
e-mail from Judge Habeck to Judge Jorgensen
prosequendum from Winnebago Jail for 9-11-15

Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts appeared by video means.  Attorney Raj Singh present in the courtroom.   Prosecuting Atty Catharine Denise White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Singh speaks with his client outside of the courts presence.  Atty Singh reads an inmate correspondence to the court and informs the court that after speaking with the defendant today, the defefendant has changed his mind and does not want Atty Singh to withdraw.  Atty Singh just received discovery 4 days ago and would like to discuss with his client.  Reschedule the plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in court with Attorney Raj Kumar Singh.  Defendant Jeremiah J Roberts in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. enters a plea of NG.

Singh addresses the court indicating his client's wishes to waive his right to a PH. Court questionsed the Def. who then verbally waives his right to a PH.
